originalText.text: Old school feel and badass triumph race motorcycle shop! Sixth St. has been in the scene a long time, and the shop shows it! Super knowledgeable and ready to work on your bike, not only triumphs either! my repair was for my Harley, so inquire within and visit a piece of motorcycle history! Check them out! üëäüèº

originalText.text:
I randomly visited this shop because when I went to my dealer their mechanic said my dual sport, that had black drips on it and was rusting after one day in the rain, was that way because hot oil dripped down and all I needed to do was clean it off. I didn't argue but you can't just clean away rust.

As soon as I arrived, Hugh came out to greet me and asked if I was okay and if I was coming to hang out. Which was very nice. I told him my concerns and was ready with my tools to pop the seat off when instructed to. Two seconds later he tells me that they sold me a bike with no tube running off the battery. So what they told me was oil, was actually battery acid eating at my baby. I knew something wasn't right.  I've had my license a long time but this is my first bike so I'm, to say the least, ready to raise hell fire.

Not exactly sure how I want to handle all of that but I'm very sure that this will be the shop I send any and everyone I meet or know who needs work because of how chill he was and because he gave me a hose and put it on with not a word about money. True integrity. I'll definitely be back.

Thanks Hugh!

originalText.text: I've been there several times over the last two years with a Royal Enfield and a BSA. Another shop once quoted $377 for a repair on the Enfield that Hugh fixed in less than 5 minutes with a screwdriver, no new parts needed, and didn't even take any money for his time. That really saved me that day! He and Fumi are super knowledgeable and will save you a ton of money if you have a British bike because they've seen so many and know these bikes better than anyone, so they're not going to waste the time most other mechanics will just trying to figure out how to do basic things on your Brit bike at $95/hr. They're really honest and top notch at working on these bikes. I couldn't recommend a shop or mechanics better than this shop and these two.

originalText.text: Called about ongoing electrical issues on my '08 t-100. Josh and the team got my job done in 1 week including diagnosing the multiple issue and fixing them. I finally feel like my bike is running as it should after 2 years of issues. Professional, communicative, and knowledgeable. There are closer mechanics including the Triumph Dealership, but I'd much prefer to bring my bike to Sixth Street for any future work.
